duties_responsibilities.duty: Direct the manufacturing front line team to meet customer needs and achieve standards related to cost, line efficiencies, waste, safety, and productivity.
Apply knowledge of TPM processes, equipment, and system capability for challenging individual and facility standards.
Set and achieve performance standards with regards to safety, line utilization, and quality.
Develop a team to solve day-to-day operational issues and reach short- and long-term performance goals.
Deliver effective change leadership to drive business changes while minimizing people impact.
Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally to assist the team to solve operational issues.
Motivate team members to achieve plan goals.
Track key performance indicators/costs, anticipating and correcting trends which would compromise achievement of financial targets.
Oversee and ensure facility equipment reliability to minimize downtime.
Lead cross-functional/departmental teams.
Build people capability through effective employee relations, hiring, training, and communication for front-line hourly personnel.
Ensure compliance with all health & safety regulations.
Administer policies and procedures.
Regular and predictable attendance at the work site.
Requires regular presence on the plant floor.
Requires lifting up to 40 lbs. occasionally.
Requires occasional work in poor weather conditions, including heat, cold, rain, or snow.
May operate forklift and manufacturing equipment occasionally.
May require off-shift and weekend work.
May require some travel (less than 5%).

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required. Preferably in engineering, business, operations management, or similar field.
